Name.BusinessNameLine1: THE CHILDREN'S CENTER OF HAMDEN INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The Children's Center of Hamden, Inc. is a private nonprofit multi-service agency. It is dedicated to providing a safe and nurturing environment for children in treatment for behavioral, emotional and/or learning disabilities in order for them to grow and develop within a setting that fosters positive childhood experiences.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE CHILDREN'S CENTER OF HAMDEN IS A PRIVATE NONPROFIT MULTI-SERVICE AGENCY DEDICATED TO PROVIDING QUALITY TREATMENT AND EDUCATION IN A SAFE, NURTURING ENVIRONMENT FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES IN THE LEAST RESTRICTIVE SETTING. OUR BOARD OF DIRECTORS VALUES THE CONTRIBUTIONS OF ITS DIVERSE WORKFORCE AND MONITORS THE MANAGEMENT OF AGENCY RESOURCES SO THAT EMPLOYEES CAN FOSTER POSITIVE AGE APPROPRIATE EXPERIENCES FOR CHILDREN AND YOUTH WITH BEHAVIORAL, EMOTIONAL AND/OR LEARNING DISABILITIES. MULTIDISCIPLINARY TREATMENT TEAMS ARE TRAINED TO ENHANCE THE WELLNESS AND TO PROTECT THE PRIVACY OF THOSE We SERVE. WHILE CONTINUOUSLY ASSISTING EACH CHILD AND FAMILY TO ASSESS THEIR NEEDS AND ACCESS THEIR STRENGTHS, WE STRIVE TO PROVIDE SERVICES THAT ARE RESPECTFUL AND WELCOMING OF DIVERSE CULTURES AND IDENTITIES.
IRS990.Description: RESIDENTIAL - TO PROVIDE RESIDENCE, NUTRITION, AND SHELTER TO APPROXIMATELY 83 CHILDREN each month.

Activity2.Description: EDUCATION - TO PROVIDE EDUCATION TO APPROXIMATELY 86 CHILDREN.

Activity3.Description: DAY TREATMENT, SUBSTANCE ABUSE COUNSELING and community based services - TO PROVIDE SUBSTANCE ABUSE COUNSELING TO APPROXIMATELY 44 PATIENTS each month AND TO PROVIDE COUNSELING, NUTRITION AND SPECIAL SERVICES TO approximately 55 children each month WHO DO NOT RESIDE AT THE CENTER.

ActivityOther.Description: BONDING EXPENSE - AMOUNT OF DEPRECIATION EXPENSE OFFSET BY BONDING REVENUE

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: A lobbyist is paid by the Organization to initiate and to maintain direct contact with legislative officials through email, organized meetings and by maintaining a physical presence at the various legislative buildings.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Organization adopted the new accounting for uncertainty in income taxes guidance on July 1, 2009. The adoption of that guidance did not result in the recognition of any unrecognized tax benefits and the Organization has no unrecognized tax benefits at June 30, 2010. The Organization's U.S. Federal information returns prior to fiscal year 2007 are closed and management continually evaluates expiring statutes of limitations, audits, proposed settlements, changes in tax law and new authoritative rulings.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Aftercare Program was discontinued due to a cut in funding for that program. This service provided a range of discharge and transitional planning and supportive services for committed youth residing at the Childrens center of Hamden who were being prepared for discharge. The services were provided by a Discharge Coordinator who served as a resource to treatment teams.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Management prepares the data to be included in the Form 990. The Organization then has the Form 990 prepared by an independent accountant. The Chair of the Finance Committee and/or Board President will review a draft of the Form 990 before final submission.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organization has a conflict of interest policy that is completed annually by members of the Board of Directors, agency administrators and department directors. If any conflicts are identified, it is the practice of Management to review and monitor the conflict.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ANNUALLY REVIEWS COMPENSATION LEVELS TO DETERMINE IF AMOUNTS ARE REASONABLE AND FAIR.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes it's governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements available to the public upon written request.
The process has not changed since the prior year.
